name: Milk Expressive Eau de Parfum
about: Fragrance Family: Warm & Spicy..Scent Type: Warm & Sweet Gourmands..Key Notes: Cold Milk, Mahogany Wood, and Marshmallow..Fragrance Description: Seeking comfort in the familiar, this creamy and calming scent offers the perfect start to the day. Cold Milk adds a cooling element to an otherwise rich and warm fragrance of marshmallow, mahogany wood, and tonka bean...About the Bottle: The Expressive Collection is an homage to Commodity‚Äôs classic black-and-white bottles. The similar look reflects that Commodity‚Äôs original formulations are now housed within the Expressive Scent Space, and that these middle ground perfumes are the perfect balance of plus and minus...About the Fragrance: I was inspired by the memory of a family vacation in the fall, when we spent hours around fires, telling stories and making s‚Äômores. I wanted to capture the nostalgia of this moment in a fragrance. Milk Expressive is a balance of sweet elements contrasted with firewood.  ‚ÄìChristelle Laprade, Maker..
ingredients: SD-Alcohol 40-B (Alcohol Denat.), Parfum/Fragrance, Aqua/Water/Eau, Coumarin, Eugenol, Benzyl Benzoate....The list of ingredients is subject to change, please consult the packaging of the product purchased.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Spritz one to two times directly on the pulse points, such as your wrists, inner elbows, or sides of the neck. .-Pulse points are warmer areas of the body that act as natural diffusers when emitting a scent..-After application, allow the scent to air dry. .-Rubbing or dabbing will break down a fragrance and cause it to wear off more quickly..-If you wear fragrance on the wrists, be sure to reapply after frequent handwashing..-Properly store your bottle to extend its shelf life, including recapping after each use and avoiding direct sunlight... Eau de Toilette or Eau de Parfum?: .The difference lies in the volume of perfume oil. While EDT contains five to nine percent, EDP contains more, usually eight to 14 percent. EDPs, therefore, last longer and smell more intense...Recycling Instructions: .-While Commodity works toward fully recyclable packaging, most of your fragrance can currently be recycled. .-Box, paper notecard, and pulp tray should be recycled as paper. .-Glass bottle and metal pump should be recycled as glass. .-Cellophane and bottle cap should be thrown in the trash.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Beautiful, Sweet, warm, cozy, creamy, woody, comforting, powdery, slightly musky, delightful, and even somewhat delicate and elegant. This is such a very lovely fragrance. It opens with a slightly creamy milky scent, with sweet and powdery marshmallows, and a soft musk. As it starts to dry down it becomes more warm and cozy with the tonka bean and slightly sweet woody scent of the mahogany. Even with its warm and cozy feel it still somehow feels delicate and elegant too.  This is really lovely! I‚Äôm actually surprised by how much I really love this fragrance! It reminds me of something, but I can‚Äôt quite put my finger on it. It Kind of makes me think of a vanilla milkshake with just a drop of honey and with just a little sprinkle of cinnamon, but also with the other notes and how I described it above too.  I do think Commodity Milk is a great fragrance for most vanilla lovers. I think it can work well year round as it‚Äôs not too heavy, but that it will be especially beautiful in the colder weather of fall and winter. I think it‚Äôs a fairly safe blind buy if you enjoy vanillas and are drawn to these notes.  I get great performance with Commodity Milk Expressive. The longevity is really good, it lasts the entire day on me. The projection is nice too, it radiates out at least a few feet from me. I do think this is actually a good value because I only need just a few sprays to get these effects.  I do enjoy some lactonic fragrances, but I‚Äôm also slightly hesitant of them sometimes. I really love this one as well as really enjoy Philosophy Fresh Cream Warm Cashmere, Philosophy Fresh Cream, and VS Tease Creme Cloud (which to me is a light and airy vanilla). I also have Ellis Brooklyn Vanilla Milk. I don‚Äôt dislike it, but I don‚Äôt enjoy it like the others, possibly because it‚Äôs the most milky/lactonic smelling one to me.

You definitely get the toasted marshmallow, there's a sweetness and roasted smokiness together with a muskiness that makes it a very sexy fragrance. I can't stop smelling myself whenever I spray. If you don't like it initially, wait for the dry down. It may seem strong at first but the dry down is heavenly.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brunette hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Cozy, toasty, yummy. It has a woodiness to it that gives off mystery and moodiness. I usually am not a fan of sweet vanilla scents, but this is lactonic and it's balanced. It's fluffy marshmellows over a campfire, but in a sophisticated, alluring way.  I started with a sample, bought the sampler set, bought a travel size and then took the plunge to buy the holiday set for the full size.  It's a great fall/winter scent that STICKS to clothes, gives a medium projection and lasts for HOURS. 2 sprays is all it takes for me. I love this as a solid base to layer with to increase the longevity of lighter fragrances.   I loved wearing this to study in the library because it put me in the academic headspace. I returned to college as an adult for Biology. I had to stop wearing it on campus because 18-20 year old kids would interrupt me in the middle of study sessions to flirt and comment on my scent. So buyer beware, unless that's the demographic you're looking to attract lol.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Porcelain skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I initially received a sample of the personal space concentration level and it immediately shot to the top of my favorite fragrances. I spritz and rub it into my wrists and neck to blend with my natural scent and it is like I'm surrounded by subtle little pops of charred marshmallow and dark, woodsy yumminess. It's rich, warm, and deeply alluring.  I found the lowest concentration wore off quickly, so I've since purchased the travel-sized vials in the expressive and bold intensity levels to get a feel for what they would be like and finally pulled the trigger on a full-sized bottle of the medium-strength fragrance. I've even given a sample-sized vial to my bestie and they loved it as well.  (Pro tip, don't let it just sit on top of your skin like a body spray. reviews.review_title: Surprisingly delightful and not too sweet
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Fair skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I received a sample of Milk Expressive with my last order, and ooh!! Its very nice. I don't generally like sweet, vanilla, or overly/typically feminine scents, so I wasn't expecting to like this as much as I do.  I sprayed a bit on the carton to get an idea of the scent. From there it was very woody, with a lot of smoke, but nice. I didn't smell much else from that, but my boyfriend said it was something he'd wear!  Alas, on the skin, it's completely different. There's the teeeeeniest hint of smoke, barely noticeable but just enough so that it definitely rounds out the scent. I don't really get any wood. The main scent is a soft, vanilla marshmallow, not too sweet, and not a *warm* vanilla, but very cozy. On top of that theres a cooling scent - almost like mint, but not quite - that gives a little fresh tingle almost exactly like cold milk. It is indeed a cozy scent, without being cloying.  I actually really like this and would love to get a bigger size once the sample runs out! Something to wear on a cold day while cuddled up in a blanket with a hot drink and a cat on the lap as a video of a fireplace crackles away on the telly.  Very curious to try the smokier Bold version too!
Beautiful fragrance, very feminine yet spicy. Makes me feel like I‚Äôm glamorously bathing in milk like Cleopatra. Kind of reminds me of eggnog, too.

reviews.review_title: Not the milky marshmallow scent I expected
reviews.review_text: Got a sample of Milk Expressive in the Sephora favorites set and was actually really excited to try this out. However, when I sprayed it on my skin, my experience of this fragrance was just confusing. I was feeling milk where?? From the name and the notes, I was expecting a warm cozy milky scent maybe sweetened by the marshmallow. Yet on my skin (disclaimer: my body chemistry does pull more smoky and woody for most scents), this perfume smells mostly sharp and cool woody. In the air I do get whiffs of a soft scent but when I get too close to my skin, I cannot stand this scent. It pulls very masculine on my and i do enjoy the scent a bit more on my husband. When I sprayed the fragrance on paper, I finally get why marshmallow is listed as a note. In the opening you get the powdery opening that resembles the outer layer of a marshmallow, artificial but not sweet. It‚Äôs just powdery. As it dries down, the scent becomes predominantly woody again. Would not purchase myself.

I want to be able to smell my perfume and I want others to be able to smell it too, without being offensive. This is a big compliment getter and my guy loves this on me! Whenever I wear this, people seem to gravitate toward me and tell me I smell good when they hug me. I love lactonic scents and this one is my favorite!!!

I bought a discovery set from commodity recently and fell in love with the gold expressive but found myself reaching for the milk more than ever. reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Let me just start off by saying this is hands down the most complimented perfume I‚Äôve ever worn!  This became my signature after the first wear when people couldn‚Äôt stop telling me I smelt amazing!!  It‚Äôs like a lactonic, slightly toasted marshmallow - with some added spice to make it seductive and borderline unisex. I wouldn‚Äôt tag ‚Äúmilk‚Äù as a note I personally get, but I feel comfortable using the word creamy, or milky to describe the way the marshmallow is delivered, not too sweet.. just dreamy, milky & slightly toasted.  The dry down is even more gorgeous, the spice softens out and you get a musky marshmallow trail following you almost all day. This is what I want to smell like all winter long & I feel like I‚Äôm neglecting my other fall/winter bottles now that I have Milk.  I definitely would recommend this scent to anyone who wants something different than their regular vanilla fragrance. This baby has my heart!  Projection 10/10  Longevity 9/10 seems like anyone within 3-6ft catch a slight sniff when sprayed on my neck & wrists for a solid 6 hours.
